Soal Beli Solar Antre Panjang, Gubernur Sulsel Minta Pertamina Cek
07 Nov 2019, 09:27 by Noval Dhwinuari Antony


Foto: Noval Dhwinuari Antony-detikcom

Makassar - Dalam beberapa hari terakhir terjadi antrean konsumsi bahan bakar minyak (BBM) jenis solar terjadi di Kota Makassar. Gubernur Sulawesi Selatan (Sulsel) Nurdin Abdullah meminta Pertamina memberi penjelasan terkait hal tersebut."Kita minta supaya ada statement dari Pertamina supaya masyarakat tahu, tidak khawatir," ujar Nurdin di Kantor Gubernur Sulsel, Jalan Urip Sumoharjo, Makassar, Kamis (7/11/2019).Antrean solar di Makassar terjadi dalam pekan ini. Seperti yang terpantau di sejumlah SPBU di kawasan Jalan Perintis Kemerdekaan, Makassar, tampak antrean kendaraan mulai dari truk hingga bus antarkota antar provinsi mengantre hingga ke jalan. Akibatnya lalu lintas saat jam kerja dan pulang kerja menjadi macet.Terkait kondisi ini, Nurdin juga tengah melakukan koordinasi dengan pihak Pertamina. Nurdin menegaskan, yang lebih bertanggungjawab soal untuk memberi penjelasan ialah Pertamina."Kita minta (penjelasan) apa penyebabnya, apakah karena suplai terlambat ataukah cuaca ekstrem, kan banyak hal yang bisa terjadi, mungkin tankernya ada masalah di jalan sehingga suplainya agak tersendat," imbuhnya.Namun Nurdin menilai antrean solar ini bukan disebabkan adanya oknum yang ingin mengambil keuntungan besar. "Kalau (disebabkan) spekulan, solar sih saya kira nggak, bensin mungkin," tuturnya.Nurdin khawatir antrean BBM di Makassar akan merembet ke kabupaten/kota lainnya di Sulsel. Hal ini karena Makassar menjadi pintu masuk BBM ke wilayah Sulsel."Pasti kan berdampak ke Kabupaten lain karena suplainya, intinya kan dari sini. Kalau Makassar terganggu pasti yang lain juga terganggu," ucapnya.Penjelasan PertaminaDikonfirmasi terpisah, Senior Supervisor Communication Pertamina MOR VII Sulawesi, Ahad Rahedi menegaskan stok BBM jenis solar ada dan tersedia. Pertamina mengimbau agar masyarakat agar tidak panik dan membeli BBM diluar kebutuhan."Kami menyalurkan BBM Solar sesuai dengan kuota penugasan yang diberikan oleh pemerintah, bahkan sampai dengan bulan September 2019 kami sudah menyalurkan BBM solar melebihi kuota yang ditugaskan, upaya penyesuaian yang kami lakukan agar supaya BBM Solar dapat tetap tersedia sampai dengan akhir tahun tanpa melebihi angka kuota yang sudah ditetapkan," jelas Ahad.Lebih lanjut Ahad mengatakan, adanya antrean solar bukan berarti terjadi kelangkaan."Stok di kami aman dan tersedia, adanya antrian belum tentu berarti terjadi kelangkaan, antrian juga bisa terjadi akibat peningkatan konsumsi, karena proses penyelesaian proyek-proyek infrastruktur jelang akhir tahun," paparnya. Problem Buying a Long Solar Queue, the Governor of South Sulawesi Ask Pertamina to Check
Nov 7 2019, 09:27 by Noval Dhwinuari Antony


Photo: Noval Dhwinuari Antony-detikcom

Makassar - In the last few days there has been a queue of diesel fuel consumption in Makassar City. The Governor of South Sulawesi (Sulsel) Nurdin Abdullah asked Pertamina to provide an explanation regarding this matter. "We ask that there be a statement from Pertamina so that the public knows, no worries," Nurdin said at the South Sulawesi Governor's Office, Jalan Urip Sumoharjo, Makassar, Thursday (7/11) /2019).Antrean diesel in Makassar occurred this week. As observed in a number of gas stations in the Perintis Kemerdekaan Road, Makassar, there were queues of vehicles ranging from trucks to intercity buses between provinces lining up to the road. As a result, traffic during working hours and after work comes to a standstill. Regarding this condition, Nurdin is also coordinating with Pertamina. Nurdin stressed that Pertamina was responsible for giving an explanation. "We asked (for an explanation) what caused it, was it due to late supply or extreme weather, many things could have happened, maybe the tankers had problems on the road so that the supply was a little choked up," he added However, Nurdin assessed that the solar queue was not caused by a person who wanted to take large profits. "If (due to) speculators, diesel fuel, I think not, gasoline might be," he said. Nurdin was worried that the fuel line in Makassar would spread to other districts / cities in South Sulawesi. This is because Makassar is the entrance of BBM to the South Sulawesi region. "Certainly it will affect other regencies because of the supply, the point is from here. If Makassar is disturbed, others will also be disrupted," he said. Pertamina Explanation Confirmed separately, Pertamina Senior Supervisor Communication MOR VII Sulawesi On Sunday Rahedi asserted that there were and available types of diesel fuel stock. Pertamina urges people not to panic and buy fuel out of necessity. "We distribute Solar Fuel in accordance with the assignment quota given by the government, even up to September 2019 we have distributed diesel fuel beyond the assigned quota, our adjustment efforts so that Solar fuel can remain available until the end of the year without exceeding the specified quota figures, "explained Sunday. Further Sunday said, the solar queue does not mean scarcity occurs." Our stock is safe and available, a queue does not necessarily mean scarcity, queues can also occur due to increased consumption, because the process of completing infrastructure projects towards the end of the year, "he explained.
